title.narrative: EDUCATION RESPONSE TO IDPS CHILDREN

description.narrative: School-age children of Internally Displaced Population especially girls access education in safe, protected and child-friendly learning environments., which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls, boys, families and communities assessed with humanitarian needs due to crisis have access to goods and services in education, nutrition & health, child protection, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) and social protection to save lives and assist recovery through proven cost-effective participatory interventions focused on the rights of the child, and equity and gender considerations.

mailing-address.narrative: C/o UNICEF Amman P.O. Box 1551 Amman 11821

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
